description:
## ARIA

If the progress bar is describing the loading progress of a particular region of a page,
you should use `aria-describedby` to point to the progress bar, and set the `aria-busy`
attribute to `true` on that region until it has finished loading.

classes.description:
Override or extend the styles applied to the component.
See [CSS API](#css) below for more details.

color.description: The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component.

type.name: chained

disableShrink.description:
If `true`, the shrink animation is disabled.
This only works if variant is `indeterminate`.

size.description:
The size of the circle.
If using a number, the pixel unit is assumed.
If using a string, you need to provide the CSS unit, e.g '3rem'.

value.description:
The value of the progress indicator for the determinate and static variants.
Value between 0 and 100.

variant.description:
The variant to use.
Use indeterminate when there is no progress value.

name: CircularProgress

descriptions.root: Styles applied to the root element.
descriptions.static: Styles applied to the root element if `variant="static"`.
descriptions.indeterminate: Styles applied to the root element if `variant="indeterminate"`.
descriptions.colorPrimary: Styles applied to the root element if `color="primary"`.
descriptions.colorSecondary: Styles applied to the root element if `color="secondary"`.
descriptions.circle: Styles applied to the `circle` svg path.
descriptions.circleStatic: Styles applied to the `circle` svg path if `variant="static"`.
descriptions.circleIndeterminate: Styles applied to the `circle` svg path if `variant="indeterminate"`.
descriptions.circleDisableShrink: Styles applied to the `circle` svg path if `disableShrink={true}`.
